text: so the bully project is a feature
documentary film that takes us into the
lives of five families that are dealing
in very different ways with bullying
over the course of one school year so
definitely we found a lot of our
characters through just following up on
people that were writing into blogs and
then to you know responding to stories
and telling their stories and sort of
reaching out and asking people if they
would consider or want to be part of the
making of the bully project we also
really fortunate that we were given
access to two schools in Sioux City Iowa
which is sort of amazing when you think
about it you know if you're reaching out
to schools and saying first of all it's
very hard to film in schools to begin
with and secondly to say and by the way
we're doing a film about bullying and we
want I'm sort of unhindered access to
see how you guys deal with it what this
looks like beyond the buses being let
you know in all those places where it
could happen the thing that I think let
them be comfortable with doing that was
the idea that this will make us better
like this will be a mirror that we can't
see ourselves over the course of the
film one of the ways in which we spend
time with our central character alex is
a seventh grader is we ride the school
bus with him in and out of school and in
in those scenes you know we do see
bullying and we see other students
bullying him in quite violent and sort
of scary ways so much so that we ended
up actually having to kind of break that
line as filmmakers and actually
intervene and bring footage to his
family into the school so that you know
the situation could be stopped I think
that's one of the things when you when
you look at school culture and climate
is if there's a school or if you have a
situation where bullying is kind of like
like generally unchallenged where the
culture kind of allows it to be then
they're not it's not doesn't seem like
the sort of worst thing in the world to
bully somebody and I think that's why I
can continue
so I think in the case of you know in
Alex's case and other stories we looked
at a lot of times it did take place in
front of adults it did take place in
front of other students it it was sort
of the kind of thing that happened so
much that no one really noticed it
except of course like the kid that is
being victimized one hope is that you
know certainly we hope that young people
that watch the bully project will feel
compelled to intervene will feel
compelled to like not be that bystander
that is in the background while bullying
is happening but actually steps up and
stands for someone that is in that
situation
